metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27218 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in GNOME GLib before 2.66.7 and 2.67.x before2.67.4. If g_byte_array_new_take() was called with a buffer of 4GB or moreon a 64-bit platform, the length would be truncated modulo 2**32, causingunintended length truncation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27218` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libglib2.0-0 - 2.64.6-1~ubuntu20.04.2
libglib2.0-bin - 2.64.6-1~ubuntu20.04.2
libglib2.0-data - 2.64.6-1~ubuntu20.04.2
libglib2.0-tests - 2.64.6-1~ubuntu20.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glib2.0 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.64.6-1~ubuntu20.04.2').
